node.title: N.Y.C. companies that donâ€™t rely on the global supply chain are faring quite well.
node.alt: Science technology company Nanotronics, which uses local manufacturing, is doing well while many other companies have struggled from supply chain woes.
node.content: ["Clogged ports. Product shortages overseas. Overburdened container ships. Price increases.", "For businesses that rely on the global supply chain, this holiday season has become particularly stressful. But at manufacturers like Nanotronics, a science technology company in the Brooklyn Navy Yard in New York City that sources most of its components locally, things are going swimmingly.", "\u201cThere is nothing we have right now that is behind schedule,\u201d said Matthew Putman, the chief executive of the company, which makes items like robotic microscopes. \u201cWe don\u2019t rely on ships right now that are stuck at ports in Los Angeles.\u201d", "Businesses that emphasize local production have been rewarded during this tumultuous time. They\u2019ve been able to fulfill orders quickly for existing clients and have attracted new ones who can\u2019t get what they need from manufacturers overseas.", "\u201cWe\u2019ve had people reach out to us to start new businesses who thought they would be sourcing abroad,\u201d said Joanna Reynolds, the associate director of Made in NYC, an initiative of the Pratt Center for Community Development that supports local manufacturers and makers. \u201cNow they want to make their products in New York City.\u201d So far, the group has added 171 members during the pandemic.", "City manufacturing hubs have also expanded over the past 18 months. The Brooklyn Navy Yard, which sits on the East River, has leased an additional 300,000 square feet, and Industry City, in Sunset Park, has filled an additional 800,000 square feet. \u201cMore companies are understanding they want their office, their design, their manufacturing, even their customers right next to their warehouse distribution,\u201d said Andrew Kimball, the chief executive of Industry City. \u201cWe can do all those things here.\u201d"]
